TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Clayey-skeletal, mixed, superactive Aquic Argicryolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Saragote loam - woodland.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted)
0i--1 inch to 0; decomposing organic matter.
A--0 to 8 inches; very dark gray (10YR 3/1) loam, black (10YR 2/1) moist; few fine distinct strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) mottles: moderate coarse granular structure; slightly hard, friable, sticky and slightly plastic; common medium, many fine and very fine roots; common fine interstital pores; 5 percent cobbles; medium acid; clear wavy boundary.  (8 to 10 inches thick)
Bt1--8 to 14 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) very cobbly clay loam, dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; few fine distinct strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) mottles; strong fine subangular blocky structure; very hard, firm, sticky and plastic; common medium, many fine and very fine roots; common fine and few very fine tubular pores; few thin clay films on faces of peds and lining pores; 10 percent pebbles, 25 percent cobbles; medium acid; clear wavy boundary.  (3 to 8 inches thick)
Bt2--14 to 32 inches; pinkish gray (7.5YR 6/2) very cobbly clay, brown (7.5YR 5/2) moist; common large distinct strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) mottles; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; very hard, firm, very sticky and very plastic; few medium, common fine and few very fine roots; common fine and few very fine tubular pores; many moderately thick clay films on faces of peds and lining pores; 10 percent pebbles, 30 percent cobbles; medium acid; gradual wavy boundary.  (18 to 32 inches thick)
C--32 to 60 inches; light brown (7.5YR 6/4) very cobbly clay, brown (7.5YR 5/4) moist; common large distinct strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) mottles; massive; very hard, firm, very sticky and very plastic; few medium, fine and very fine roots; few fine tubular pores; 10 percent pebbles, 30 percent cobbles; medium acid.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Rio Arriba County, New Mexico; approximately 11 miles east of Tierra Amarilla; New Mexico, state plane coordinates 2,077,622 north and 467,958 east; 106 degrees, 21 minutes, 36 second west longitude; 36 degrees, 42 minutes, 36 seconds north latitude.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Soil Moisture:  The soil is saturated in some part of the SMCS during spring and early summer.
Mean annual soil temperature:  37 to 39 degrees F.
Mean summer soil temperature:  40 to 42 degrees F.
Reaction:  Slightly acid to medium acid.
Depth to Mottles:  0 to 24 inches.
Thickness of mollic epipedon:  10 to 14 inches.
Depth to water table:  2 to 3.5 feet from March through June, due to snowmelt water.
Particle-size control section:  35 to 50 percent clay.
Other features: chromas in the lower part of the mollic epipedon are tpyically 3.  In areas with chroma of 2 or less in the lower part, mottles are below 18 inches.
A horizon:  Value 3 or 4 dry, 2 or 3 moist. Chroma:  l or 2.  Rock fragments: 0 to 10 percent cobbles.
Bt horizon:  Value 5 or 6 dry, 3 through 5 moist. Texture:  Clay loam or clay. Rock fragments: 10 to 15 percent pebbles, 25 to 40 percent cobbles.
C horizon:  Rock fragments - 10 to 15 percent pebbles, 25 to 40 percent cobbles.  Texture: very cobbly clay loam or very cobbly clay.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  There are no competing series in the same family.  A similar soil is Animas(CO).  Animas soils are 20 to 40 inches to a paralithic contact and have less than 35 percent clay in the particle-size control section.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Saragote soils formed in alluvium from metamorphic rock on mountains.  Slopes range from 2 to 5 percent.  The mean annual precipitation is 32 to 35 inches and the mean annual temperature is 35 to 37 degrees F.  Elevation 9,500 to 11,400 feet and the frost-free period is 50 to 70 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are Angostura, Croftshaw, and Ess soils.  Angostura, Croftshaw, and Ess soils have less than 35 percent clay in the particle-size control section.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Somewhat poorly drained; slow runoff; slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Saragote soils are used for wood products, livestock grazing and wildlife habitat.  The present vegetation is a forest of Englemann spruce, corkbark fir, subalpine fir, aspen with understory of subalpine timothy, mutton grass, and blue grasses.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  North central New Mexico.  Series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Rio Arriba County, New Mexico, 1989.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon are:
Mollic epipedon:  The zone from the surface of the soil to a depth of 14 inches.  (A and Bt1 horizons)
Argillic Horizon:  The zone from about 8 to 32 inches (Bt horizons)
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
